content: This is a support community of mostly users helping each other. Would you like help?
creator: mozilla98

content:
I'll repeat my question from https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1442347 - who is your mail provider? Also please:

  • Full Thunderbird version
  • Your OS
  • Does it help to disable status bar at View > Toolbar > statusbar
  • Regarding "crashes & closes multiple times per day" - did that only start with version 140? Do you have crash reports at Help > Troubleshooting Information (scroll down)? What is your antivirus software?
  • Does problem change with Setting accessibility.force_disabled to "1"
creator: wsmwk

content:
Same here, versions 142 and 143 crashing on Windows 10, I cannot use it for more than 5 minutes.

Tryed in a VM (VirtualBox), Windows 10 clean, same thing, so, not related to other installed softwares.

Logs shows errors in: C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\xul.dll Version: 143.0.0.231 Exception: 0xc0000409 Desloc: 0x0000000007dca33d and 0x000000000824d00d
creator: arvyrogerio

content:
> Same here, versions 142 and 143 crashing on Windows 10, I cannot use it for more than 5 minutes.

The reporter indicates their problem start with 140. Yours starting in 142 suggests they are not the same.

Please check for crash IDs and accessibility.force_disabled set to "1"
creator: wsmwk

content:
My accessibility.force_disabled is set to "1". No difference.

After 50+ crashes in a day, I realized that the problem appears to be related to the UI. When I click in a folder, or scroll the bar, drag and drop a message to a folder, etc. When I'm writing, reading, or keep it waiting for new messages, nothing happens. Only crashes when I interact with "elements" in the interface. And never crashed without interaction (if I keep it minimized for long time).

Not related to the machine, no other softwares crashed. It's an Intel i9, Windows 10 installed only 2 months ago, very stable and light, no "strange" softwares running.
creator: arvyrogerio

content: Full Thunderbird version - 140.2.1esr (32-bit) Your OS - Windows 10 22H2 19045.6332 Does it help to disable status bar at View > Toolbar > statusbar - haven't tried Regarding "crashes & closes multiple times per day" - did that only start with version 140? - yes, crashed & closed 20+ times the first day, now I know not to click on it while it's 'hung' not responding to cursor movements, not showing circle of death at cursor, & not grayed out (previous version grayed when it hung & then resumed without crashing & closing) Do you have crash reports at Help > Troubleshooting Information (scroll down)? - unknown What is your antivirus software? - McAfee Does problem change with Setting accessibility.force_disabled to "1" - unfamiliar with that
creator: geodave50

content: David, does the problem occur in Windows safe mode with networking enabled?
creator: mozilla98

content:
> Does problem change with Setting accessibility.force_disabled to "1" - unfamiliar with that 

Settings > Config Editor > paste in  "accessibility.force_disabled" > click the pencil to change the "0" to "1"
creator: wsmwk

content: Went to 'Settings' & didn't see any 'Config Editor' so entered 'Config Editor' in the 'Find a setting' field and got the result "No results for Config Editor"
creator: geodave50

content: Settings > General > Config Editor > paste in "accessibility.force_disabled" > click the pencil to change the "0" to "1"

content:
Rogerio Vitiello said
Here is one of my logs... BuildID: 20250910231831 CrashTime: 1758198092 InstallTime: 1758110775 ModuleSignatureInfo: {"Mozilla Corporation": ... WindowsErrorReporting: 1

For better results, please create your own topic at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/thunderbird

And please answer the following questions there: 1. when did the crashing start and with which version? You can find your version history at Help > Troubleshooting info > update history 2. you are not getting a mozilla crash report as described at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/mozilla-crash-reporter-tb 3. does the crashing stop if you start windows in safe mode? https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode
creator: wsmwk

content:
Translation:

Every time the program starts, it begins indexing all emails in the mailbox, which takes a long time, and during this time I cannot export emails. The mailbox contains a substantial amount of data accumulated over several years, but I cannot archive part of it since this information is constantly used in my work. Are there any settings available to index only a specific period of emails instead of the entire mailbox?
creator: mozilla98

content: Right-click a folder, Properties, there is a checkbox to enable global search indexing.

Sono almeno tre anni che è così: Google sta progressivamente attivando a tutti i suoi utenti il login tramite Oauth2. Senza scomodare l'AI c'è una dettagliata guida a tal proposito -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-gmail

content:
Forse è stato attivato il nuovo Centro account Lo puoi disattivare da

Menu > Impostazioni > Generale Sezione Centro account Togli la spunta da Crea account nel nuovo Centro account

A questo punto puoi usare la vecchia procedura automatica -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/configurazione-automatica-account

o la procedura manuale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/configurazione-manuale-account

content:
Are you asking Thunderbird support why Yahoo is rejecting messages? Yahoo knows better. Did you read the explanation of the error message? Have you tried contacting Yahoo?

By the way, AOL uses Yahoo e-mail. That is why you received the same error message from both.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Yahoo come Gmail ed altri usa Oauth come metodo di autenticazione, e quindi chiede l'uso di cookie. È così dal 2020, è impossibile che tu te ne sia accorto solo ora -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=74783.0 -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-yahoo#w_modifiche-importanti-al-metodo-di-autenticazione

Se non vuoi abilitare i cookie, devi creare una password per applicazione da usare su Thunderbird -> https://it.aiuto.yahoo.com/kb/new-mail-for-desktop/SLN15241.html

content:
Try this.

Open your TB profile:

- TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information

- click the Application Basics > Profile Folder 'Open Folder' button

- close TB

- delete the xulstore.json file in the profile folder

- restart TB

content: If the account is IMAP, you've lost nothing. Just reactivate the account. If POP, you may have lost all messages downloaded to date.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you for your help. The incoming server on the account is a POP server. The outgoing server is SMTP. The account was not deactivated, it was deleted, and the profile seems to have disappeared. Sounds like I am up the creek without a paddle?
creator: mark.abels

content:
If you didn't check the box to remove the mail during the account removal, it's possible to recover the mail:

https://kb.mozillazine.org/Recovering_deleted_mail_accounts
creator: sfhowes

content: From your words, I infer you just deleted from Thunderbird, not from the email provider. If true, that means you lost what has been downloaded, but the account is probably still there with undownloaded/new messages. You're right,thought, about the ones. In the future, should you want to deactivate a POP account, my suggestion is to first copy the messages to local folders.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks again, David. Unfortunately, I always set up my email accounts to delete emails from the server once they have been downloaded to my pc. I do back them up locally on a separate hard drive. But if the solution is to re-download from the POP server to my PC it's too late.
creator: mark.abels

content: Thanks, SFHowes. I will check this out.
